Dialogue.NPCText:
A gaunt, blindfolded prophet sways in the market square, sunlight glinting off the charms braided into his beard. His empty gaze meets yours.

"You… you walk in shadow, yet bear the scent of distant dawn. I am Farim, once seer to kings, now cast adrift in Sunreach’s swirling tides.

What brings you? Is it truth you seek, or merely fortune?"

Option.text: You are Farim the prophet? What do you see?
I heard you need help. Tell me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farim tilts his head, listening to voices only he can hear.

"All roads here lead to crossroads—of sand and secrets, of coin and conscience. Sunreach is a stage; the Council plays at power while darker hands draw the curtains.
Yet sometimes the sun’s path is bent. Even a blind man may light another’s way, if given the means."
He frowns, troubled.
"But I am diminished. Minax’s agents stole from me the Heliotrope Relic—a fragment of light that sharpens my visions. Without it, my warnings are mere whispers."

Option.text: Can I help recover your relic?
Tell me more of your visions.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farim’s hands trace invisible glyphs in the air.

"I see a city drowned in golden light, its rulers gnawed by their own shadows. The Gem of Immortality glimmers, shattered yet yearning to be whole. Minax’s hand is everywhere, yet so is the seed of rebellion.
Beware the one who smiles with two faces, and trust not the council when gold changes hands."
His blind eyes gleam.
"Will you help me see more clearly? Only with the relic can I pierce the veils that Minax draws over Sunreach."

Option.text: I will find your relic, if I can.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farim clasps your hand with surprising strength.

"My sight is darkness without the Heliotrope Relic—a crystal stolen by Minax cultists who fester in Sunreach’s old cisterns. Their leader, the madman called Sul Vek, twists the relic’s power for his own unholy rites."

"Retrieve it, and not only will I see—so shall you. I will reveal what others hide, for the sun shows all in time."

Will you brave the undercity for the sake of light?"

Option.text: I will retrieve the Heliotrope Relic.
Where do I find Sul Vek and his cultists?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farim’s voice is fierce:
"Go now. Beneath Sunreach, through the old well behind the spice market, you will find the way to the cisterns. Sul Vek and his zealots defile the place—beware their blood magic.
Return the relic, and I will repay you with sight beyond sight… and perhaps a secret the Council would kill to learn."

Option.text: I will not fail you, Suncaller.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"The path lies beneath the city: seek the cracked well behind the spice market. Descend in darkness, but carry hope—the cultists fear the sun’s touch. Sul Vek marks his lair with banners of crimson and gold. He will not part with the relic willingly."
Farim’s mouth twists in wry humor.
"You may find allies—or traitors—in those depths. Choose your trust as you would choose your weapons."

"The Heliotrope Relic is a sunstone crystal, said to be touched by the first light of dawn. With it, I see not just futures, but the present as it is—truth without shadow.
The cultists use it to glimpse hidden places, but their minds are poisoned by Minax’s lies. If you return it, I will show you things even the Council cannot conceal."

Option.text: I will seek it for you.
I have questions about Sul Vek.
I’ll return when I am ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farim bows, fingers brushing a sun-charm at his throat.
"The market’s clamor drowns most wisdom. Seek me if your path grows dark… or if you wish to see with new eyes."

Farim’s lips twitch into a sad smile.

“My story? It drifts like desert sand—true in parts, obscured in others. But if you have time and mind enough to listen, I shall paint the echoes in sunlight."

He leans on his cane, listening for your silence.

"I was once a vizier to the Qasarian court. A ‘light-seer,’ they called me. My visions were praised, feared, ignored. That is the fate of truth.
But when I spoke of Minax’s return—of the Gem’s slow reformation—I was cast out. I wandered, blindfolded by choice, to see what lies within, not without."

He chuckles.
“Sunreach took me in. Barely.”

Option.text: How did you know of Minax?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I once trusted my eyes too much—and they showed me only splendor. Wealth. Power. Lies wrapped in silk.
But with darkness, I learned to hear what the light cannot speak. Sight is not just what the eye beholds—it is the soul’s reckoning."
He tilts his head toward you.
"Can *you* see beyond the veil, wanderer?"

Option.text: I try to see with both eyes and heart.
I trust what I can see, nothing more.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farim smiles.
“Then may the dawn guide your path."
He reaches toward your brow and murmurs a blessing.

“Then I pity you,” Farim sighs. “Sight without understanding is like a sword without a hilt. It cuts all, even its bearer.”
He turns slightly away, muttering something in an ancient tongue.

Option.text: Wisdom cloaked in riddles is still shadow.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Farim’s voice drops.

“She appeared first in dream. Then in fire. Always where the world was weakest—fractures of the old Gem bleeding through reality.
I saw her weaving her net across shards, whispering promises to the ambitious. Not conquest—rebirth. Not cruelty—balance. That is how she seduces.”

“The Council fears her. I understand her.”

“No,” he says quietly. “But I do not hate her either. She is a mirror to our failings. She does not destroy—she accelerates.”
He tilts his head toward you.
“Would you follow her, if she offered you power enough to reshape the world?”

“Then beware,” he whispers. “Minax does not tempt with lies. She tempts with truth.”
The air chills subtly around you.

“Then do not look away from what must be done. She feeds on our divisions, our secrets, our pride.”
“Unite those who dwell in shadow. Raise voices in forgotten tongues. Remember: prophecy is not fate. It is warning.”

“Betrayed? Mmm.”
“Some betray by sword. Some with silence. When I spoke the truth of Qasaria’s corruption, none defended me. Even Zaida—my pupil once—stood with the Council."
“Now she returns, asking questions, seeking secrets.”
He exhales slowly.
“Would you hear a secret in return?”

Farim leans close, whispering in your ear.
“There is a vault beneath the Council’s Hall—marked only with a golden sunburst. Inside lies a relic… not of this world. Not even Minax dares claim it.”
“If you wish answers the Council fears, start there. But tread carefully—truth can blind even the faithful.”
